alert.note: Alert for Glacier; Pondera (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 2:35AM MDT until June 22 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Localized minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Glacier and Pondera. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over a few secondary roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 AM MDT, Minor flooding is expected across portions of the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain fell yesterday, with some areas experiencing one of their wettest days on record. Although rain has ended, runoff will continue to work downstream today. - Some rivers, streams, and creeks that could experience rises in water levels include...Saint Mary River, Badger Creek, and Cut Bank Creek. - Some locations that may experience minor nuisance flooding include... Cut Bank, Browning, Valier, North Browning, South Browning, Heart Butte, East Glacier Park, East Glacier Park Village, Kiowa, Starr School, Saint Mary, Babb, Santa Rita, Dupuyer, Many Glacier and Goat Haunt.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
